item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数温和上升
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济的美国人数量略有上升，但飓风海伦在美国东南部的肆虐以及波音公司和港口的罢工可能会在短期内扭曲劳动力市场的状况。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits rose marginally last week, but Hurricane Helene's rampage in the U.S. Southeast and strikes at Boeing and ports could distort the labor market picture in the near term.】

item.title: 西班牙橄榄油受美国港口罢工影响，看不到替代路线
item.description: 世界最大的橄榄油生产国西班牙的橄榄油出口商警告说，在美国东海岸和墨西哥湾沿岸港口罢工的情况下，没有通往利润丰厚的美国市场的可行替代路线。【原文：Olive oil exporters in Spain, the world's biggest producer, have warned there are no viable alternative routes to the lucrative U.S market amid a strike at U.S. East and Gulf Coast ports.】

item.title: 李维-施特劳斯股价下跌，因预计假日季度业绩低迷
item.description: 李维-斯特劳斯公司（Levi Strauss）周四在盘前交易中股价大跌约 11%，因为该公司预测假日季度收入不佳，这家牛仔布生产商正努力应对零售商需求疲软、消费者减少消费的局面。【原文：Levi Strauss' shares slumped about 11% in premarket trading on Thursday after it forecast tepid holiday quarter revenue as the denim maker grapples with weak demand from retailers with consumers paring back spending.】

item.title: 埃克森公司与杰罗姆港炼油厂工会达成协议，允许继续实施裁员计划
item.description: 能源巨头埃克森美孚公司发言人周四表示，在本周与工会达成多数协议后，该公司可以继续推进在法国北部杰罗姆港炼油厂的裁员计划。【原文：Energy major Exxon Mobil can move ahead with a plan to cut jobs at its Port Jerome refinery in northern France after obtaining a majority agreement this week with unions, a company spokesperson said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国参议员沃伦要求监管机构对花旗施加增长限制
item.description: 一位著名的美国民主党参议员周三呼吁最高监管机构对花旗集团实施增长限制，因为这家华尔街银行正在努力解决持续存在的监管问题。【原文：A prominent Democratic U.S. senator called on a top regulator on Wednesday to impose growth restrictions on Citigroup as the Wall Street bank struggles to fix ongoing regulatory problems.】

item.title: 美国向 EVgo 提供 10.5 亿美元有条件贷款用于电动汽车充电站建设
item.description: 美国周四向电动汽车公司（EVgo）提供了高达 10.5 亿美元的有条件贷款担保，用于在全国范围内扩建公共电动汽车充电基础设施，其中一些设施位于城市边缘社区。【原文：The United States on Thursday offered EVgo a conditional loan guarantee of up to $1.05 billion to expand public electric vehicle-charging infrastructure across the country, some of which in marginalized urban communities.】

item.title: 市场与中东：投资者如何经受地缘政治的考验
item.description: 中东冲突再次升级，但由于石油生产的变化以及全球降息使地缘政治黯然失色，整个金融市场的情绪目前仍然乐观。【原文：Conflict in the Middle East is escalating once more, but the mood music across financial markets remains upbeat for now due to shifts in oil production and as global interest rate cuts eclipse geopolitics.】

item.title: 招聘公司 Challenger 称，9 月份美国计划裁员人数下降
item.description: 周四发布的月度裁员公告统计显示，9月份美国的裁员公告从8月份的五个月高点下滑，但今年迄今为止的裁员速度已超过去年。【原文：U.S. layoff announcements slipped in September from August's five-month high but for the year to date have now edged past last year's pace, a monthly tally of workforce reduction announcements showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 亚马逊计划为假期招聘 25 万名员工，与去年持平
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon）周四表示，由于预计2024年最后一个季度的电子商务支出将超过整体假日销售额，该公司计划在这个假日购物季招聘25万名运输和仓库工人，人数与去年持平。【原文：Amazon plans to hire 250,000 transportation and warehouse workers this holiday shopping season, the same number as last year as e-commerce spending is expected to outpace overall holiday sales in the final quarter of 2024, the company said on Thursday.】

item.title: 投资者质疑股息，Stellantis 股价跌至逾两年低点
item.description: 在本周早些时候发布利润预警后，Stellantis 的股价在周四进一步下跌，原因是人们对该汽车制造商股息的可持续性感到担忧。【原文：Stellantis shares fell further on Thursday amid concerns over the sustainability of the automaker's dividend following a profit warning earlier this week.】

item.title: 投资者等待劳动力数据，评估中东风险，期货下跌
item.description: 美国股指期货周四下滑，市场在等待有关经济前景和美联储进一步降息可能性的数据，同时关注中东敌对行动的潜在升级。【原文：U.S. stock index futures slipped on Thursday as markets awaited data for insights on the economic outlook and the likelihood of further interest-rate cuts from the Federal Reserve, while watching for a potential escalation in Middle East hostilities.】

item.title: 海伦飓风暴露了联邦紧急事务管理局在阿巴拉契亚地区的援助缺口
item.description: 随着北卡罗来纳州西部居民的生活逐渐恢复正常，能够依靠联邦洪水保险的居民将寥寥无几。【原文：As residents of western North Carolina piece together their lives, few will be able to rely on federal flood insurance.】

item.title: 美国写字楼市场在大幅打折促销后出现触底迹象
item.description: 分析师告诉路透社记者，陷入困境的美国办公物业市场可能正在触底反弹，他们指出，在过去一个季度里，一连串受压物业以大幅折扣出售，帮助确立了新的定价基准。【原文：The beleaguered U.S. office property market may be bottoming out, analysts told Reuters, pointing to a string of sales of stressed properties at big discounts over the last quarter that have helped set a new pricing benchmark.】

item.title: 早间竞价：欧洲和日本鹰派联合造势，美元大涨
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: Uber 和 Lyft 司机将特斯拉用作临时机器人出租车，引发安全担忧
item.description: 今年 4 月，一辆为优步（Uber）服务的自动驾驶特斯拉汽车在拉斯维加斯郊区的一个十字路口撞上了一辆 SUV，这起事故引发了新的担忧，即越来越多的自称 "机器人出租车 "正在利用美国城市的监管灰色地带，危及生命安全。【原文：A self-driving Tesla carrying a passenger for Uber rammed into an SUV at an intersection in suburban Las Vegas in April, an accident that sparked new concerns that a growing stable of self-styled "robotaxis" is exploiting a regulatory gray area in U.S. cities, putting lives at risk.】

item.title: Airbnb 推动游客天堂里约的短租热潮
item.description: 2019 年，当卡洛斯-爱德华多-穆兹第一次在 Airbnb 上出租他在里约热内卢海边的公寓时，他只是想赚点外快。他得到的是一份管理约 100 处房产的职业，以及一个科技平台如何改变南美最著名旅游目的地之一的前沿席位。【原文：When Carlos Eduardo Muzy first rented his beachside Rio de Janeiro apartment on Airbnb in 2019, he just wanted some extra cash. What he got was a career managing some 100 properties – and a front-row seat to how the tech platform is transforming one of South America's most famous tourist destinations.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局称，特斯拉将召回超过 2.7 万辆 Cybertruck 汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周四表示，特斯拉将在美国召回27185辆Cybertruck汽车，原因是延迟的后视影像降低了车辆后方的可视性。【原文：Tesla is recalling 27,185 Cybertruck vehicles in the U.S. as a delayed rear view image reduces visibility behind the vehicle, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Thursday.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：美国限制措施迫在眉睫，中国药明康德探索出售制药部门
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周四援引熟悉内情的人士的话报道称，中国生物技术公司药明康德（WuXi AppTec）和药明生物（WuXi Biologics）正致力于出售其部分业务，这两家公司正成为美国即将出台的国家安全立法的目标。【原文：Chinese biotech companies WuXi AppTec and WuXi Biologics , which are being targeted by a forthcoming U.S. national security legislation, are working on sales of some of their operations, the Financial Times reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美联储大幅降息为各国央行 9 月宽松周期增添动力
item.description: 在美国联邦储备委员会的带领下，发达市场央行在 9 月份推出了自 COVID-19 疫情爆发时的宽松浪潮以来最大规模的降息举措，而巴西则开启了新一轮的紧缩周期。【原文：Led by the U.S. Federal Reserve, developed market central banks in September delivered their biggest interest rate cut push since the easing wave at the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic, while Brazil kicked off a fresh tightening cycle.】

item.title: SWIFT 将于明年试行实时数字货币交易
item.description: 全球银行报文传送网络 SWIFT 周四表示，明年将试行代币化资产和数字货币的实时交易，这是将此类资产融入更广泛的金融体系的最新进展。【原文：Global bank messaging network SWIFT will trial live transactions of tokenised assets and digital currencies next year, it said on Thursday, the latest step in the currently slow-moving integration of such assets into the wider financial system.】

item.title: 欧佩克+可以缓解伊朗石油冲击，但不能缓解更广泛的破坏
item.description: 如果以色列摧毁伊朗的设施，欧佩克有足够的备用石油产能来弥补伊朗供应的全部损失，但如果伊朗报复性地打击其海湾邻国的设施，该生产国集团就会陷入困境。【原文：OPEC has enough spare oil capacity to compensate for a full loss of Iranian supply if Israel knocks out that country's facilities but the producer group would struggle if Iran retaliates by hitting installations of its Gulf neighbours.】

item.title: 2024 年剩余时间新兴市场货币将保持稳定或收窄涨幅
item.description: 路透社的一项民意调查显示，在美国联邦储备委员会抑制了激进降息的预期之后，大多数新兴市场货币在未来三个月内将在狭窄的区间内交易，或缩减今年迄今为止的部分涨幅。【原文：Most emerging market currencies are set to trade in tight ranges or pare some of the year-to-date gains in the next three months after the U.S. Federal Reserve curbed expectations for aggressive rate cuts, according to a Reuters poll.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称澳新银行、古纳万家族考虑出售印尼帕宁银行的控制权
item.description: 三位知情人士透露，澳大利亚澳新银行（ANZ）和印尼古纳万（Gunawan）家族正在考虑出售在雅加达上市的印尼潘宁银行（Bank Pan Indonesia Tbk PT，简称 "潘宁银行"）的联合控股权，双方均持有该银行的大量股份。【原文：Australian lender ANZ and Indonesia's Gunawan family are considering selling a combined controlling interest in Jakarta-listed Bank Pan Indonesia Tbk PT (Panin Bank) , in which they each hold substantial stakes, three sources with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 码头工人罢工进入第三天，美国港口船舶排队现象加剧
item.description: 周四，集装箱船在美国主要港口外排起了长队，因为近半个世纪以来最大规模的码头工人罢工已进入第三天，罢工阻碍了卸货，并威胁到从香蕉到汽车零部件等各种产品的短缺。【原文：Long lines of container ships queued up outside major U.S. ports on Thursday as the biggest dockworker strike in nearly half a century entered its third day preventing unloading and threatening shortages of everything from bananas to auto parts.】

item.title: 美元看跌者关注全球收益率和经济增长的变化，以应对美元走软
item.description: 随着全球央行纷纷降息，货币市场也随之动荡不安，交易员们正密切关注着全球各经济体的相对实力，以衡量如何最有效地应对美元下滑。【原文：Traders gauging how to best play a sliding U.S. dollar are eyeing the relative strength of economies around the world, as rate cuts from global central banks shake up currency markets.】

item.title: 早间竞标：采购经理人指数为降息铺平道路
item.description: Stella Qiu 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Stella Qiu】

item.title: 菲律宾对科技巨头的数字服务征收 12% 的增值税
item.description: 菲律宾国内税收机构周四表示，菲律宾将对亚马逊、Netflix、迪士尼和 Alphabet 等科技巨头提供的数字服务征收 12% 的增值税（VAT），此举将与国内实体企业公平竞争。【原文：The Philippines will impose a 12% value-added tax (VAT) on digital services offered by tech giants such as Amazon , Netflix , Disney , and Alphabet , in a move that will level the playing field with domestic brick and mortar players, the internal revenue agency said on Thursday.】

item.title: 日本央行加息押注减弱，日本股市反弹，日元走软
item.description: 由于今年进一步收紧货币政策的风险减弱，日本股市周四跳涨，日元下跌，而香港股市的飙升势头也得到了喘息。【原文：Japanese stocks jumped and the yen fell on Thursday as the risk of further tightening in monetary policy this year faded, while the sizzling rally in Hong Kong's share market took a breather.】

item.title: 在日本央行总裁的出生地，上田的政策之谜昭然若揭
item.description: 要想了解日本央行行长上田一夫在使世界第四大经济体摆脱货币刺激政策方面所面临的挑战，请看他的出生地。【原文：For a sense of the challenges Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda faces in weaning the world's fourth-largest economy off monetary stimulus, look no further than his birthplace.】

item.title: 日本央行决策者呼吁缓慢谨慎地上调利率
item.description: 日本央行的一位鸽派决策者周四表示，日本央行有进一步加息的空间，但必须谨慎而缓慢地行动，以避免对经济造成伤害，这强化了市场对日本央行不会急于提高借贷成本的看法。【原文：Japan's central bank has scope to raise interest rates further but must move cautiously and slowly to avoid hurting the economy, a dovish policymaker said on Thursday, reinforcing market views it will be in no rush to lift borrowing costs.】
